item.description:
Every Year The Town of Burlington invites hundreds of local business, town, state agencies, police and fire departments to park their Trucks and other Vehicles on the Town Common for the public to enjoy.

This takes place from 10:00AM to 3:00PM on Sunday.

Bring your camera and take plenty of pictures:

Of the Bulldozer - like the one that wrecked the Red Sox season,

Of the Garbage Truck - like the one with all of the fried chicken bones and scraps

Of the Recycle Truck - with the empty, broken beer bottles from the Sox club house

Of the Dump Truck - full of Red Sox debris

Of the Septic Truck - the one that is cleaning up the stench at Fenway

Of the Ambulence - like the ones that took all of the injured Sox players to the hospital before they went on the Disabled List

Of the Fire Truck - that have been putting out fires at Fenway all year long

Of  the Police Vehicles - soon to respond to the next 911 call envolving an incident with Alfredo Aceves in the dugout

Of the Limo's - that escorted Kevin Youkilis, Josh Beckett, Carl Crawford, Adrian Gonzales, and Nick Punto to the Airport

Of the Mobile Television Trucks - covering the Bobby V. watch

Of the Construction Trucks - that will be used to rebuild the team

Nothing to do with the Sox!!! 

Check this out and then head over to Scoreboard in nearby Woburn to watch the Patriots Season Opener at 1:00pm.
item.name: 15th Annual Burlington Truck Day - How Does This Relate to The Red Sox?
